post_text:
Stockbridge Community Schools has suspended its search for a superintendent until further notice in response to mitigating the spread of Coronavirus (COVID-19). The board of education will evaluate the superintendent search process when it is safe to hold meetings again. All board of education meetings and committee meetings are canceled until our next regular board of education meeting scheduled for April 20th.

Thank you for your understanding.

post_text:
Dear Staff and Families,

Late Last night, Governor Gretchen Whitmer and State Superintendent Michael Rice announced the closure of all Michigan PK-12 school buildings, public, private and boarding, starting Monday, March 16 through Sunday, April 5. Limited staff may be in the buildings, but the buildings will not be accessible to the general public or any student.

Today we will be open for school.

We ask that all staff and students take home their personal belongings from their lockers, classrooms and office/desk spaces at the end of today.

We are still working through the details of this announcement. We will continue to communicate with staff and families through our school messaging system as more information is available.

Expect an additional message later today.

Thank you for your understanding.

Karl Heidrich
Superintendent

post_text:
Stockbridge Community Schools Board of Education recently invited community members to participate in a Superintendent Search survey, aimed at soliciting input on the qualities, experiences, and skills needed in the new superintendent.
Stakeholders may provide input through the convenient online survey, which will remain open until 5:00pm on February 19th, 2020.

Survey link:
https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/stockbridgesearch

The survey is being administered by the MASB Executive Search team on behalf of the District and takes about ten minutes to complete. Anonymous individual responses will be combined with those from the face to face meetings with stakeholders to provide important community input to the Stockbridge Board of Education as it seeks to identify the best candidate for the position.

The survey is being administered by the MASB Executive Search team on behalf of the District and takes about ten minutes to complete. Anonymous individual responses will be combined with those from the face to face meetings with stakeholders to provide important community input to the Stockbridge Board of Education as it seeks to identify the best candidate for the position.
